info.title: Google Picasa
info.description: The Picasa Web Albums Data API allows for websites and programs to integrate with Picasa Web Albums, enabling users to create albums, upload and retrieve photos, comment on photos, and more!

parameters.name: albumID
parameters.description: The album ID.

parameters.name: authkey
parameters.description: Authorization Key.

parameters.name: GData-Version
parameters.description: The API version. Current version is 2.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: If you want to make sure that you dont delete an album that has been changed by another client since you retrieved it, include an HTTP If-Match header that contains the original albums ETag value. You can determine the original albums ETag value by examining the  elements gd:etag attribute. If you want to delete the album regardless of whether someone else has updated it since you retrieved it, then use If-Match: * and dont include the ETag. (In this case, you dont need to retrieve the alb

parameters.name: tok
parameters.description: Authorization Key.

parameters.name: userID
parameters.description: The Picasa User ID. The string default can be used in place of a real user ID, in which case the ID of the user whose credentials authenticated the request is used.

put.summary: Search User Album Photos Using Tags
put.description: Search User Album Photos Using Tags

parameters.name: albumID
parameters.description: The album ID.

parameters.name: authkey
parameters.description: Authorization Key.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Content type.

parameters.name: GData-Version
parameters.description: The API version. Current version is 2.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: To make sure that your update doesnt overwrite another clients changes, include an HTTP If-Match header that contains the original albums ETag value. You can determine the original albums ETag value by examining the  elements gd:etag attribute. If you want to update the album regardless of whether someone else has updated it since you retrieved it, then use If-Match: * and dont include the ETag.

parameters.name: tok
parameters.description: Authorization Key.

parameters.name: userID
parameters.description: The Picasa User ID. The string default can be used in place of a real user ID, in which case the ID of the user whose credentials authenticated the request is used.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: To make sure that your update doesnt overwrite another clients changes, include an HTTP If-Match header that contains the original albums ETag value. You can determine the original albums ETag value by examining the  elements gd:etag attribute. If you want to update the album regardless of whether someone else has updated it since you retrieved it, then use If-Match: * and dont include the ETag.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Content type.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: To make sure that your update doesnt overwrite another clients changes, include an HTTP If-Match header that contains the original albums ETag value. You can determine the original albums ETag value by examining the  elements gd:etag attribute. If you want to update the album regardless of whether someone else has updated it since you retrieved it, then use If-Match: * and dont include the ETag.

parameters.name: albumID
parameters.description: The album ID.

parameters.name: commentID
parameters.description: The comment ID.

parameters.name: GData-Version
parameters.description: The API version. Current version is 2.

parameters.name: photoID
parameters.description: The photo ID.

parameters.name: tagID
parameters.description: The tag ID.

parameters.name: userID
parameters.description: The Picasa User ID. The string default can be used in place of a real user ID, in which case the ID of the user whose credentials authenticated the request is used.

parameters.name: albumID
parameters.description: The album ID.

parameters.name: GData-Version
parameters.description: The API version. Current version is 2.

parameters.name: photoID
parameters.description: The photo ID.

parameters.name: tagID
parameters.description: The tag ID.

parameters.name: userID
parameters.description: The Picasa User ID. The string default can be used in place of a real user ID, in which case the ID of the user whose credentials authenticated the request is used.

parameters.name: access
parameters.description: Visibility parameter.Applicable values:- all: Shows all data, both public and private. Requires authentication. Default for the owner, and only the owner can specify this value.- private: Shows only private data. Requires authentication. Only the owner can specify this value.- public: Shows only public data. Does not require authentication. Most often used by an authenticated user to see only the publicly visible photos, corresponding to View My Public Gallery in the Picasa Web Albums GUI.- visi

parameters.name: alt
parameters.description: Alternative representation type. If you dont specify an alt parameter, the service returns an Atom feed. This is equivalent to alt=atom.Applicable values:- rss: returns an RSS 2.0 result feed (for reads only). When you request data from a service in RSS format, the service supplies a feed (or other representation of the resource) in RSS format. If theres no equivalent RSS property for a given Data API property, the service uses the Atom property, labeling it with an appropriate namespace to in

parameters.name: bbox
parameters.description: Bounding-box search of geo coordinates. Searches for data in the specified bounding box. The coordinates should be in the following order: west, south, east, north.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Response filter Returns only the requested portions of the resource representation, for improved performance and efficiency, rather than the full resource representation.For example:http://www.example.com/feeds?fields=link,entry(@gd:etag,id,updated,link[@rel=edit]))When it receives this request, the server returns a response that contains only only link and entry elements for the feed. In addition, the entry elements returned are partial entries that contain only ETag, ID, updated, and edit li

parameters.name: GData-Version
parameters.description: The API version. Current version is 2.

parameters.name: imgmax
parameters.description: Image size parameter. Valid with album or photo kinds; specifies what image size to use for the media:content. Only a single value may be specified. Refer to the list of valid values below.

parameters.name: kind
parameters.description: Picasa Web Albums-specific query parameter for kind queries.Applicable values:- album: Feed includes some or all of the albums the specified user has in their gallery. Which albums are returned depends on the visibility value specified. User-based feed- photo: Feed includes the photos in an album (album-based), recent photos uploaded by a user (user-based) or photos uploaded by all users (community search). Album-based, user-based and community search feeds- comment: Feed includes the comments t

parameters.name: l
parameters.description: Named search of geo data. Searches for data in the named location. An example location would be London.

parameters.name: max-results
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to be retrieved. For any service that has a default max-results value (to limit default feed size), you can specify a very large number if you want to receive the entire feed.

parameters.name: prettyprint
parameters.description: Returns an XML response with identations and line breaks. If prettyprint=true, the XML returned by the server will be human readable (pretty printed). Default: false

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Full-text query string. When creating a query, list search terms separated by spaces, in the form q=term1 term2 term3. (As with all of the query parameter values, the spaces must be URL encoded.) The service returns all entries that match all of the search terms (like using AND between terms). Like Googles web search, a service searches on complete words (and related words with the same stem), not substrings.To search for an exact phrase, enclose the phrase in quotation marks: q=exact phrase. T

parameters.name: start-index
parameters.description: 1-based index of the first result to be retrieved. Note that this isnt a general cursoring mechanism. If you first send a query with ?start-index=1&max-results=10 and then send another query with ?start-index=11&max-results=10, the service cannot guarantee that the results are equivalent to ?start-index=1&max-results=20, because insertions and deletions could have taken place in between the two queries.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Tag filter parameter. Filters photos in the user-based and album-based feeds by the specified tag.

parameters.name: thumbsize
parameters.description: Thumbnail size parameter. Valid with album or photo kinds; specifies what image size to use for thumbnails. Multiple values may be specified using a comma-delimited list. If multiple values are specified, multiple media:thumbnail elements will be returned in the feed. Refer to the list of valid values below.

parameters.name: access
parameters.description: Visibility parameter.Applicable values:- all: Shows all data, both public and private. Requires authentication. Default for the owner, and only the owner can specify this value.- private: Shows only private data. Requires authentication. Only the owner can specify this value.- public: Shows only public data. Does not require authentication. Most often used by an authenticated user to see only the publicly visible photos, corresponding to View My Public Gallery in the Picasa Web Albums GUI.- visi

If theres no equivalent RSS property for a given Data API property, the service uses the Atom property, labeling it with an appropriate namespace to in

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Response filter Returns only the requested portions of the resource representation, for improved performance and efficiency, rather than the full resource representation.For example:http://www.example.com/feeds?fields=link,entry(@gd:etag,id,updated,link[@rel=edit]))When it receives this request, the server returns a response that contains only only link and entry elements for the feed. In addition, the entry elements returned are partial entries that contain only ETag, ID, updated, and edit li

parameters.description: Returns an XML response with identations and line breaks. If prettyprint=true, the XML returned by the server will be human readable (pretty printed). Default: false

parameters.name: Slug
parameters.description: When posting a photo without metadata, one could specify a filename for Picasa Web Albums to use for the photo using this parameter. Not specifying a Slug causes the server to use a default title for the image. When posting with metadata, use the  element within the request body for the filename you want to use for the image.

User-based feed- photo: Feed includes the photos in an album (album-based), recent photos uploaded by a user (user-based) or photos uploaded by all users (community search). Album-based, user-based and community search feeds- comment: Feed includes the comments t

parameters.name: l
parameters.description: Named search of geo data. Searches for data in the named location. An example location would be London.

parameters.name: max-results
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to be retrieved. For any service that has a default max-results value (to limit default feed size), you can specify a very large number if you want to receive the entire feed.

parameters.name: photoID
parameters.description: The photo ID.

parameters.name: prettyprint
parameters.description: Returns an XML response with identations and line breaks. If prettyprint=true, the XML returned by the server will be human readable (pretty printed). Default: false

parameters.name: start-index
parameters.description: 1-based index of the first result to be retrieved. Note that this isnt a general cursoring mechanism. If you first send a query with ?start-index=1&max-results=10 and then send another query with ?start-index=11&max-results=10, the service cannot guarantee that the results are equivalent to ?start-index=1&max-results=20, because insertions and deletions could have taken place in between the two queries.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Tag filter parameter. Filters photos in the user-based and album-based feeds by the specified tag.

parameters.name: thumbsize
parameters.description: Thumbnail size parameter. Valid with album or photo kinds; specifies what image size to use for thumbnails. Multiple values may be specified using a comma-delimited list. If multiple values are specified, multiple media:thumbnail elements will be returned in the feed. Refer to the list of valid values below.

parameters.name: userID
parameters.description: The Picasa User ID. The string default can be used in place of a real user ID, in which case the ID of the user whose credentials authenticated the request is used.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Content type.

parameters.name: GData-Version
parameters.description: The API version. Current version is 2.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: To make sure that your update doesnt overwrite another clients changes, include an HTTP If-Match header that contains the original albums ETag value. You can determine the original albums ETag value by examining the  elements gd:etag attribute. If you want to update the album regardless of whether someone else has updated it since you retrieved it, then use If-Match: * and dont include the ETag.
